intro: Exostema valenzuelae subsp. maestrense, commonly known as the Maestrense Exostema, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its distinctive floral structure. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical environments, often in areas with high humidity and well-drained soil. Its leaves are usually ovate or lanceolate, and it produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically important species.
